item.title: Hangar Bay
item.media:title: Hangar Bay
item.media:description: The ATM-73 'Minotaur' is an adaptation of the venerable AT-70 assault transport, being extensively rebuilt to serve as a combat transport for armored infantry and even some powered suits in the 10-ton range on an external rack.
item.description: The ATM-73 'Minotaur' is an adaptation of the venerable AT-70 assault transport, being extensively rebuilt to serve as a combat transport for armored infantry and even some powered suits in the 10-ton range on an external rack.

item.title: Winter in New England
item.media:title: Winter in New England
item.media:description:
Ottava Rima rhymes abababcc, and numerous medieval and Renaissance Italian poems were composed in this stanza pattern.

Written for DFC 2018 @    

Project DFC: December Form Challenge 2018
It's tiiiiiiiiimmmmeeee....
This is the namesake event of ProjectDFC; the 2018 December Form Challenge is heeeeeerrrreeee!
Hello everyone!    OneWithTheStars here and welcome to ProjectDFC's 2018 main event!
I haven't had the pleasure to be around for it during its entirety, however, we have a VERY exciting DFC this year!  We are celebrating the decennial of this absolutely marvelous challenge that has inspired monthly challenges of poetic forms, bringing together fellow poets as we torture challenge ourselves with just a sampling of the many, many poetic forms in existence around the world.  We also have a new contributor; please everyone give a hand in welcoming Amarantheans to our group!  She's a wonderful person I've come to know over the past couple of years and enjoys poetic forms as much as the rest of us.
item.media:text:
Flurries circle and swirl in a neat little dance,
landing peacefully among the newly fallen snow,
off the children go into the white expanse
where copious amounts of snowballs they will throw;
they’ll run and laugh and around they will prance,
ending the day with a steaming cup of hot cocoa;
not a single complaint of the wind or cold,
just another New England winter to behold.
item.description:
Ottava Rima rhymes abababcc, and numerous medieval and Renaissance Italian poems were composed in this stanza pattern.

Written for DFC 2018 @    

Project DFC: December Form Challenge 2018
It's tiiiiiiiiimmmmeeee....
This is the namesake event of ProjectDFC; the 2018 December Form Challenge is heeeeeerrrreeee!
Hello everyone!    OneWithTheStars here and welcome to ProjectDFC's 2018 main event!
I haven't had the pleasure to be around for it during its entirety, however, we have a VERY exciting DFC this year!  We are celebrating the decennial of this absolutely marvelous challenge that has inspired monthly challenges of poetic forms, bringing together fellow poets as we torture challenge ourselves with just a sampling of the many, many poetic forms in existence around the world.  We also have a new contributor; please everyone give a hand in welcoming Amarantheans to our group!  She's a wonderful person I've come to know over the past couple of years and enjoys poetic forms as much as the rest of us.

item.title: Gathering
item.media:title: Gathering
item.media:description:
Personal work... I'm glad to finally finish this... The original color block is completely different from this piece.
I've been keeping the color block/sketch for 3 years maybe and decided to finish It this month, and It turns out into something completely different.
I still want to play around with lasso tools and brush strokes, so decided to finish this piece using that method.

The title Itself just something random that pop up in my mind.
Too tired to think about some fancy great title these days...

I think I'll continue finish a lot of my unfinished personal work for now.
There are plenty of It... 

I also post extra stuff on my Instagram that I never post here if you interest to check.

Thank you for looking.


My Instagram
My Portfolio
Artstation Page
Artstation Portfolio Page

item.title: Frost Fairy
item.media:title: Frost Fairy
item.media:description:
Fairy-like on earth advancing,
All transforming, all entrancing,
Playing on their way and dancing,
        Soil-untarnished yet,

Silver stars from sky are dropping,
Little fairies skipping, hopping,
On the roofs and turrets popping,
        Crowns with diamonds set.

Greeting nature’s silver wedding,
Argent splendor they are shedding,
And a bridal veil outspreading,
        Like a silver net;

Philip M. Raskin

I teamed up with @thecrookedfeather and created a frost themed armor and dress to go with thecrookedfeathers frost wings! 


Frost dress/model/photgraphy: 
www.fairytas.com

Frost wings: 
www.thecrookedfeather.com/

item.title: Green Moss Terrarium Ring
item.media:title: Green Moss Terrarium Ring
item.media:description:
This is clear resin in a facet shaped silicon mold with green moss embedded in it then cured to make the center. That center piece was attached to an adjustable ring. Additional green moss was attached around and painted with more UV resin and cured again.

The moss around the ring is slightly lightly/gently/dully pokey. I took care to make the ring comfortable while being worn while keeping its unique style.

On my Etsy HERE

This is a adjustable size ring!

Etsy (MidnightValkyrieArt)
tumblr (handcrafted items)

tumblr
twitter
facebook
Instagram
RedBubble

item.title: Something has gone totally wrong
item.media:title: Something has gone totally wrong
item.media:description:
So today I finally finished a project that was stuck in my pipeline for half an year. Frustrating crushes and other difficulties were stopping me every time until I decided to
upgrade my system. I doubled my RAM and ruined me for a new GPU - yeah, a fine GTX1080Ti! And it was worth it even if I have to live now on water and dry bread
And I had to experiment with dForce to improve my skills. Btw., the Duchess Dress by Sshodan is gorgeous and the textures so precious - I'm in love with it.

                                                                                                                     
Please enlarge to have a sharper view...
Rendered as usual in DAZ with Iray and postworked in PS.
All Content from DAZ and Rero.

  • The DAZ Rose
  • Swords of History
  • Traveler's Naturals - Brambles
  • Epic Props: Godrays & Volumetric Light for Iray
  • Super Sleeky Hair for Genesis 3 Female(s) and Genesis 3 Male(s) and OOT Hairblending 2.0
  • MICK (Medieval Interior Construction Kit)
  • FWSA Jett HD for Genesis 8 Male
  • Tudor Living 2
  • Southern Noble Outfit for Genesis 8 Male(s)
  • Etta HD for Edie 8
  • dForce Duchess Dress for Genesis 3 and 8 Female(s)
item.description:
So today I finally finished a project that was stuck in my pipeline for half an year. Frustrating crushes and other difficulties were stopping me every time until I decided to
upgrade my system. I doubled my RAM and ruined me for a new GPU - yeah, a fine GTX1080Ti! And it was worth it even if I have to live now on water and dry bread
And I had to experiment with dForce to improve my skills. Btw., the Duchess Dress by Sshodan is gorgeous and the textures so precious - I'm in love with it.

                                                                                                                     
Please enlarge to have a sharper view...
Rendered as usual in DAZ with Iray and postworked in PS.
All Content from DAZ and Rero.

  • The DAZ Rose
  • Swords of History
  • Traveler's Naturals - Brambles
  • Epic Props: Godrays & Volumetric Light for Iray
  • Super Sleeky Hair for Genesis 3 Female(s) and Genesis 3 Male(s) and OOT Hairblending 2.0
  • MICK (Medieval Interior Construction Kit)
  • FWSA Jett HD for Genesis 8 Male
  • Tudor Living 2
  • Southern Noble Outfit for Genesis 8 Male(s)
  • Etta HD for Edie 8
  • dForce Duchess Dress for Genesis 3 and 8 Female(s)
